Is the tablet market resurrecting? Apple still dominates, but watch out for Amazon (photo)
01 Nov 2019, 11:05 by Vincenzo Ronca
For several years now the tablet market has suffered a sort of arrest in its growth, in particular for the Android segment that sees Samsung and a few others as major players. The latest figures presented by IDC seem to subvert, at least in part, the trend of recent years.
IDC presented the results of the analysis carried out on tablet shipments globally in the third quarter of 2019: in general it emerges that the tablet market has grown compared to the last, albeit slightly. Analyzing the individual producers, at the top we always find Apple which has also recorded a growth of around 22% compared to the same period last year. In second place we find surprisingly Amazon, which basically takes Samsung's place in terms of market share.
The giant of Jeff Bezos has also recorded the highest growth compared to last year, amounting to almost 26%. Even Lenovo, which now ranks fifth in terms of market share, reported growth compared to last year, mainly thanks to the Asian market sector. All the others have seen a decline, above all Samsung, which has slipped to third place.
